attributes.action: declare that many moles when caught in an intended kill trap,in fact remain alive, sometimes suffering cruel pain from injury, and therefore will the Prime Minister also declare,in order to secure the intended purposes of the Animal Welfare act 2006 that both live catch and spring operated mole traps should be inspected daily
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently there are NO requirements- unlike other trap use, to inspect kill traps used for the control of moles. This must cause possible un-necessary suffering,Defra states that it is good practice to check them frequently and failing to do so may leave the operator open to prosecution and it would be for a court to decide what measures could or should have been taken to to avoid or reduce any suffering. 
Therefore it must be accepted that to reduce any possible unnecessary suffering mole traps should be checked daily in line with other traps used to control animals and not be permitted to be left unchecked under bad practices until an example case is made in the courts of law.
